action: I want to safely export business data from the system in CSV or Excel format
reason: For creating external submission materials, analysis work, and backup purposes
acceptance_criteria: Data export is only executable by authenticated users.
Output permissions are controllable for each role.
Users cannot export data that exceeds their own viewing permissions.
Output target data is based on search condition filter results.
The maximum number of output items can be set (e.g., 50,000 items).
If the limit is exceeded, output is split or an error is returned.
Selection of both CSV and XLSX formats is possible.
Character encoding is unified in UTF-8.
CSV performs RFC-compliant escape processing.
Strings containing commas, newlines, and double quotes are processed correctly.
Numeric items are output in numeric format without being converted to strings.
Dates are output in ISO format.
NULL values are converted to empty strings or predefined strings.
Output columns are definable by administrators.
Sensitive information (passwords, tokens, etc.) is excluded from output.
Masking settings for personal information items are possible.
Permission checks are performed on the server side before output.
Parameterized queries are used for SQL injection countermeasures.
Values are escaped before output as an XSS countermeasure.
Output processing can be executed as an asynchronous job.
Large-volume output is processed in a background queue.
Progress status can be checked during processing.
A notification event is issued upon output completion.
Output files are saved in temporary storage.
Retention period for temporary files is configurable.
Download URLs are signed URLs.
URLs have an expiration date.
Downloads are possible only via HTTPS communication.
Other users cannot access the corresponding file.
A download count limit can be set.
Audit logs are recorded at the time of download.
Export operation logs are stored.
Logs include user_id, target data type, count, and timestamp.
Logs are stored in tamper-evident storage.
The API is REST-compliant.
API versioning is managed.
Internal information is not included in the response when an error occurs.
There is an upper limit on the number of concurrent executions during output processing.
Throttling is applied if the system load is high.
Output processing is subject to timeout control.
Job status is recorded as an error upon midway failure.
A re-execution function exists.
Output files include a header row.
Column order is fixed based on definitions.
Output settings can be changed from the management screen.
Changes to the output format are recorded in the audit log.
